conclusion: Determine the length of the transparent part of the light entering perpendicular to MN on the hemispherical lens.

The light reflects off the paraboloid and enters the hemispherical lens perpendicular to the vertical diameter MN.
The light enters the lens perpendicular to MN, striking the lens at the equator.
The radius R of the hemispherical lens is the distance from the center of the lens to any point on its surface.
The refractive index of the lens is n = 4/3.
Since the light enters perpendicular to MN, the angle of incidence is 0°, and the angle of refraction is also 0°.
The light travels straight through the lens because it enters perpendicularly.
The length of the path inside the lens is the diameter of the lens, which is 2R.
The transparent part is the portion of the lens through which light passes without obstruction.

The transparent part is a semicircle with radius R.

The length of the transparent part of the light entering perpendicular to MN on the lens spherical surface is πR.
